intro: Hieracium bauhiniflorum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, typically found in grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are surrounded by white ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open habitats. Hieracium bauhiniflorum is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
